intro: Epidendrum isochilum var. tridens, commonly known as the Trident Epidendrum, is a terrestrial orchid native to Central and South America. It features upright, branching stems that bear numerous lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers with three prominent sepals and petals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. This orchid is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in greenhouses or as a houseplant.
